title.narrative: OT4.1. CR MONITORING

description.narrative: By 2020, a child rights coordination mechanism with a clearly defined role and capacity for child rights monitoring (CRM) is established, and partnerships are sustained for generation of equity focused data on children with evidence-based programming, which is piloted for addressing gender-biased sex selection (GBSS)., which contributes to Building Capacity For Evaluation, Cross-Sectoral Monitoring, Data And Situation Analyses, Evaluation And Research, Evaluation And Research (Covid), Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices, Gender Discriminatory Roles And Practices (Covid), Social Exclusion â€“ Data And Evidence. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Advocacy And Public Engagement, Evaluations, Research And Data, Systems Strengthening And Institution Building, United Nations Working Together. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: By 2020, the justice system adequately responds to violations of children's rights, and a system is developed to recognize and prevent violence, abuse and neglect of children.

participating-org.narrative: NATIONAL INSTITUTE OF LABOUR AND SOCIAL RESEARCH

mailing-address.narrative: UNICEF Armenia UN Building 14 Petros Adamyan Street Yerevan 0010 Armenia

sector.narrative: Behavioural change communication campaigns on gender equitable roles and practices
Evaluation innovation learning, uptake and partnerships for evaluation
Stimulating demand for and capacity to use data

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: By 2020, a child rights coordination mechanism with a clearly defined role and capacity for child rights monitoring (CRM) isestablished, and partnerships are sustained for generation of equity focused data on children with evidence-based programming,which is piloted for addressing gender-biased sex selection (GBSS).

description.narrative: Amendments of the Family code and the Law on the Rights of the Child were drafted and public hearings held aiming at improving child rights coordination and monitoring by the state. Second phase of the Vulnerability assessment of families to socio-economic shocks caused by the COVID-19 pandemic was supported and methodological support and national capacity building for conducting quality and ethical studies was ensured. | Status:Partially met | As-of Date:21/01/2022

title.narrative: Number and reach of evidence-based initiatives targeting drivers of gender-biased sex selection and monitoring the change(63477), Text

baseline.value: 0 by UNICEF. Since 2012 many initiatives took off targeting various aspects of GBSS, however the main drivers of GBSS rooted in norms and stereotypes remain to be addressed

target.value: 2021:One set of TV-series is broadcasted reaching at least 50% of the country, and community based C4D activities are conducted in 5 target regions

actual.value: 2020:TV-series are developed based on audience feedback monitoring, to be broadcasted in 2021

title.narrative: Gender - Existence at scale policy frameworks to promote non-discrimination for girls and boys , Percent
Gender - Existence at scale policy frameworks to promote non-discrimination for girls and boys , Percent
Gender - Existence at scale policy frameworks to promote non-discrimination for girls and boys , Percent
Gender - Existence at scale policy frameworks to promote non-discrimination for girls and boys , Percent
HRDO has improved capacity and mechanism for doing independent child rights monitoring(63474), Text

baseline.value: HRDO roles and responsibilities mention independent child rights monitoring as one of their functions, and child rights unit exists.

target.value: 2021:HRDO conducts regular child rights monitoring based on systematized methodological framework

actual.value: 2020:HRDO conducts monitoring and reporting on regular basis

title.narrative: Ratio of child-focused SDG indicators measured (standard indicators) by country disaggregated by sex and/or age(63475), Text

baseline.value: Out of 81 child-focused SDG indicators 37% are considered to be measured as per global indicator definition

target.value: 2021:At least 35% of child-focused SDG indicators are measured as per global indicator definition and at least half of those can be disaggregated by sex and/or age

actual.value: 2020:SDG nationalization process was stalled and new indicator measurement didn't take place

title.narrative: The extent to which the state coordination mechanism for child-rights implementation with clearly defined roles and responsibilities for CRM is functional(63473), Text

baseline.value: Weak: committee for child rights is not functional, monitoring is mentioned as its function, but there is no mechanism for its implementation

target.value: 2021:Moderate: the role of CR coordination mechanism is clearly defined by law and includes secretariat and other mechanisms for being operational

actual.value: 2020:The process of review of roles and responsibilities was initiated
